summary.para: Creates a transition from a custom interpolator for a given dimension.

param.name: interpolator
param.para: The interpolator from which a transition is to be created.
The specified object must implement the interface.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

summary.para: Defines a method for creating transitions from custom interpolators.
IUIAnimationTransitionFactory2 supports the creation of transitions in a specified dimension.

remarks.para: When an application requires animation effects that are not available in the transition library, developers can implement custom transitions that the application can use. A custom transition is created by first implementing the interpolator function for the transition, and then by using a factory object to generate transitions from the interpolator. An interpolator must implement either the interface or the interface; an implementation of the transition factory object is provided by UIAnimationTransitionFactory or by UIAnimationTransitionFactory2.
